title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
Announcements

Mountain Day thoughts?
Resources to learn new tech:

Full access to all DataCamp courses for duration of semester; check your smith.edu email for invitation. Note: DataCamp is not without controversy, but with an educational license no money is exchanged.
Full access to all LinkedIn Learning curriculum.

Questions about ethics readings

title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
Today

Look at Roster Google Sheet, Groups tab, “Project GitHub Folder” column

Make sure you can see repo. If not, check email for GitHub.com invitation

Terminology:

Agile project management is an iterative approach to delivering a project throughout its life cycle.
Scrum is an agile project management framework that helps teams structure and manage their work through a set of values, principles, and practices. Video
Kanban boards: Video

GitHub Projects Kanban board
GitHub issues

title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
For next class
Make sure you can clone, i.e. make a local copy, of your project repo. If you need a refresher, go to “Screencast” tab on top right and watch “2022-09-08 Cloning a GitHub repo”

title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
1. Announcements

Introductions
Go over webpage and syllabus (click website tab)
Mantra board
Go over TODO’s
Meet our project sponsors

title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
2. Immediate TODOs

By tomorrow Friday 9am I need your info:

Complete project selection form
Complete intro survey

By tomorrow noon I will create groups:

I will create 5 groups and match groups to sponsors
I will create channels in Slack for each group and add all members
I will designate an interim group leader to ensure Sunday TODOs are done

By Sunday 5pm contact sponsor by email to set weekly meeting time:

Interim group leader will take charge just for this weekend and schedule group zoom meeting
As a group, come up with 3-4 hour long time slots you can all meet for your weekly meeting with your sponsor
Designate someone to send email to sponsor (emails here: 410 Groups, Group Members), cc’ing all group members and me and Prof. Shiya Cao (who will be teaching capstone in the spring): akim04@smith.edu scao53@smith.edu

Introduce yourselves as students in Smith College SDS’ capstone course
Include all proposed hour long time slots, ask if they work. I’ve communicated with the sponsors that this meeting should be an hour long and at a consistent time. 1.State your appreciation for sponsors agreeing to give their time

title: SDS410: Capstone in SDS
text:
3. TODOs for before Tuesday’s lecture
Megan Lyster from Wurtele Center for first of four sessions on managing group dynamics:

Read Themes from Advice for Spring 23 Capstone from Fall 22 Capstone
Read SDS Capstone Sponsor Agreement
